datasets.name: 2533a643
queryLines:
select
  date_format(date_trunc('month', u.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') as YearMonth,
  u.workspace_id,
  w.workspace_name,
  sum(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) as total_list_usd,
  sum(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 as total_heb_usd,
  case 
    when exists (
      select 1 
      from system.billing.usage u_prev
      where u_prev.workspace_id = u.workspace_id
        and date_format(date_trunc('month', u_prev.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') = 
            date_format(date_trunc('month', current_date - interval 1 month), 'yyyy-MM')
    ) then true
    else false
  end as used_last_month
from system.billing.usage u
inner join system.access.workspaces_latest w 
  on u.workspace_id = w.workspace_id
left join system.billing.list_prices lp
    on u.sku_name = lp.sku_name
    and u.cloud = lp.cloud
    and u.usage_unit = lp.usage_unit
    and u.usage_end_time >= lp.price_start_time
    and (lp.price_end_time is null or u.usage_end_time < lp.price_end_time)
    and lp.currency_code = 'USD'
group by YearMonth, u.workspace_id, w.workspace_name
having sum(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 >= 600
order by YearMonth, w.workspace_name, total_list_usd desc

datasets.name: 6481b773
queryLines:
with monthly_spend as (
  select
    date_format(date_trunc('month', u.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') as YearMonth,
    u.workspace_id,
    w.workspace_name,
    sum(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) as total_list_usd,
    sum(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 as total_heb_usd
  from system.billing.usage u
  inner join system.access.workspaces_latest w 
    on u.workspace_id = w.workspace_id
  left join system.billing.list_prices lp
      on u.sku_name = lp.sku_name
      and u.cloud = lp.cloud
      and u.usage_unit = lp.usage_unit
      and u.usage_end_time >= lp.price_start_time
      and (lp.price_end_time is null or u.usage_end_time < lp.price_end_time)
      and lp.currency_code = 'USD'
  group by YearMonth, u.workspace_id, w.workspace_name
),
last_three_months as (
  select *
  from monthly_spend
  where YearMonth >= date_format(add_months(current_date(), -2), 'yyyy-MM')
    and total_heb_usd >= 500
),
ranked as (
  select
    workspace_id,
    workspace_name,
    YearMonth,
    total_list_usd,
    total_heb_usd,
    row_number() over (partition by workspace_id order by YearMonth) as rn
  from last_three_months
)
select
  r1.YearMonth,
  r1.workspace_id,
  r1.workspace_name,
  r1.total_list_usd,
  r1.total_heb_usd,
  ((r1.total_heb_usd - r3.total_heb_usd) / r3.total_heb_usd) / 2 * 100 as avg_percent_growth_last_3_months
from ranked r1
join ranked r2 on r1.workspace_id = r2.workspace_id and r1.rn = 2 and r2.rn = 1
join ranked r3 on r1.workspace_id = r3.workspace_id and r3.rn = 3
where
  r2.total_list_usd > r3.total_list_usd
  and r1.total_list_usd > r2.total_list_usd
  and r1.total_heb_usd >= 500
order by r1.YearMonth, r1.total_list_usd desc

SELECT
  YearMonth,
  -- 5 yr forecast line includes trend line for 1.5% growth rate + 4.6m in planned migrations
  ( ((269258.23+77700)*1.02) * POWER(1.015, (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 1, 4) AS INTEGER) - 2022) * 12 + (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 6, 2) AS INTEGER) - 1))) AS five_yr_forecast_line,
  SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) AS total_list_usd,
  SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 AS total_heb_usd
FROM (
  SELECT
    date_format(date_trunc('month', u.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') AS YearMonth,
    u.usage_quantity,
    u.sku_name,
    u.cloud,
    u.usage_unit,
    u.usage_end_time
  FROM system.billing.usage u
) u
LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices lp
  ON u.sku_name = lp.sku_name
  AND u.cloud = lp.cloud
  AND u.usage_unit = lp.usage_unit
  AND u.usage_end_time >= lp.price_start_time
  AND (lp.price_end_time IS NULL OR u.usage_end_time < lp.price_end_time)
  AND lp.currency_code = 'USD'
GROUP BY YearMonth
HAVING SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 >= 600
ORDER BY YearMonth

WITH forecast AS (
  SELECT
    YearMonth,
    (((269258.23+77700)*1.02) * POWER(1.015, (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 1, 4) AS INTEGER) - 2022) * 12 + (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 6, 2) AS INTEGER) - 1))) AS five_yr_forecast_line,
    20259.89 * (ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY YearMonth) - 1) + 454105.38 AS trend_value,
    SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) AS total_list_usd,
    SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 AS total_heb_usd
  FROM (
    SELECT
      date_format(date_trunc('month', u.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') AS YearMonth,
      u.usage_quantity,
      u.sku_name,
      u.cloud,
      u.usage_unit,
      u.usage_end_time
    FROM system.billing.usage u
  ) u
  LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices lp
    ON u.sku_name = lp.sku_name
    AND u.cloud = lp.cloud
    AND u.usage_unit = lp.usage_unit
    AND u.usage_end_time >= lp.price_start_time
    AND (lp.price_end_time IS NULL OR u.usage_end_time < lp.price_end_time)
    AND lp.currency_code = 'USD'
  GROUP BY YearMonth
  HAVING SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 >= 600
)
SELECT
  f.*,
  v3.*
FROM forecast f
LEFT JOIN gdp_stage.default.v_4_consumption_data v3
  ON f.YearMonth = LEFT(v3.ds, 7) -- assumes `v3.ds` is something like '2023-08-01...'
ORDER BY f.YearMonth

datasets.name: 62401fbe
queryLines:
select
   date_format(change_time, 'yyyy MM') as YearMonth
  ,count(*) as CountOfJobs
from system.lakeflow.jobs
group by date_format(change_time, 'yyyy MM')
order by date_format(change_time, 'yyyy MM')

datasets.name: 910bf1d8
queryLines:
select 
  concat(
    cast(extract(year from period_start_time) as string), 
    '-', 
    lpad(cast(extract(week from period_start_time) as string), 2, '0')
  ) as week,
  count(*) as job_runs
from system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
group by 
  extract(year from period_start_time), 
  extract(week from period_start_time)
order by week

datasets.name: a24fd9b3
queryLines:
with list_cost_per_job as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    COUNT(DISTINCT t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id) as runs,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),
most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
),
final_results as (
  SELECT 
      t3.workspace_name,
      t2.name as job_name,
      t1.job_id,
      t1.workspace_id,
      t1.runs,
      t1.run_as,
      SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
      SUM(list_cost*.58) as heb_cost,
      t1.last_seen_date
  FROM list_cost_per_job t1 
    LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
    LEFT JOIN system.access.workspaces_latest t3 USING (workspace_id)
  GROUP BY ALL
)
SELECT 
    *,
    CASE 
      WHEN ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY list_cost DESC) <= 5 THEN true 
      ELSE false 
    END as is_top_5_job
FROM final_results
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: 8fece4db
queryLines:
WITH forecast AS (
  SELECT
    YearMonth,
    (((269258.23+77700)*1.02) * POWER(1.015, (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 1, 4) AS INTEGER) - 2022) * 12 + (CAST(SUBSTR(YearMonth, 6, 2) AS INTEGER) - 1))) AS five_yr_forecast_line,
    20259.89 * (ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY YearMonth) - 1) + 454105.38 AS trend_value,
    SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) AS total_list_usd,
    SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 AS total_heb_usd
  FROM (
    SELECT
      date_format(date_trunc('month', u.usage_date), 'yyyy-MM') AS YearMonth,
      u.usage_quantity,
      u.sku_name,
      u.cloud,
      u.usage_unit,
      u.usage_end_time
    FROM system.billing.usage u
  ) u
  LEFT JOIN system.billing.list_prices lp
    ON u.sku_name = lp.sku_name
    AND u.cloud = lp.cloud
    AND u.usage_unit = lp.usage_unit
    AND u.usage_end_time >= lp.price_start_time
    AND (lp.price_end_time IS NULL OR u.usage_end_time < lp.price_end_time)
    AND lp.currency_code = 'USD'
  GROUP BY YearMonth
  HAVING SUM(u.usage_quantity * lp.pricing.default) * 0.58 >= 600
)

SELECT
  f.YearMonth,
  f.five_yr_forecast_line,
  f.trend_value,
  f.total_list_usd,
  f.total_heb_usd,
  v3.yhat_y,
  CASE 
    WHEN f.YearMonth >= '2025-10' THEN (f.trend_value + COALESCE(v3.yhat_y, 0)) / 2
    ELSE NULL 
  END AS projected_consumption
FROM forecast f
LEFT JOIN main.billing_forecast_demo.forecast_next_12_period_v3 v3
  ON f.YearMonth = LEFT(v3.ds, 7)

UNION ALL

SELECT
  LEFT(v3.ds, 7) AS YearMonth,
  (((269258.23+77700)*1.02) * POWER(1.015, (CAST(SUBSTR(LEFT(v3.ds, 7), 1, 4) AS INTEGER) - 2022) * 12 + (CAST(SUBSTR(LEFT(v3.ds, 7), 6, 2) AS INTEGER) - 1))) AS five_yr_forecast_line,
  20259.89 * ((SELECT COUNT(*) FROM forecast) + ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY LEFT(v3.ds, 7)) - 1) + 454105.38 AS trend_value,
  NULL AS total_list_usd,
  NULL AS total_heb_usd,
  v3.yhat_y,
  CASE 
    WHEN LEFT(v3.ds, 7) >= '2025-10' THEN (20259.89 * ((SELECT COUNT(*) FROM forecast) + ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY LEFT(v3.ds, 7)) - 1) + 454105.38 + COALESCE(v3.yhat_y, 0)) / 2
    ELSE NULL 
  END AS projected_consumption
FROM main.billing_forecast_demo.forecast_next_12_period_v3 v3
WHERE LEFT(v3.ds, 7) NOT IN (SELECT YearMonth FROM forecast)

ORDER BY YearMonth

datasets.name: 0e674c70
queryLines:
with list_cost_per_job_run as (
  SELECT
    t1.workspace_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_id,
    t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id as run_id,
    SUM(t1.usage_quantity * list_prices.pricing.default) as list_cost,
    first(identity_metadata.run_as, true) as run_as,
    first(t1.custom_tags, true) as custom_tags,
    MAX(t1.usage_end_time) as last_seen_date
  FROM system.billing.usage t1 
  INNER JOIN system.billing.list_prices list_prices on
    t1.cloud = list_prices.cloud and
    t1.sku_name = list_prices.sku_name and
    t1.usage_start_time >= list_prices.price_start_time and
    (t1.usage_end_time <= list_prices.price_end_time or list_prices.price_end_time is null)
  WHERE
    t1.sku_name LIKE '%JOBS%'
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_metadata.job_run_id IS NOT NULL
    AND t1.usage_date >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 30 DAY 
  GROUP BY ALL
),

most_recent_jobs as (
  SELECT 
    *, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY workspace_id, job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) as rn
  FROM
    system.lakeflow.jobs QUALIFY rn=1
)
SELECT 
    t1.workspace_id,
    t2.name,
    t1.job_id,
    t1.run_id,
    t1.run_as,
    SUM(list_cost) as list_cost,
    SUM(list_cost)*.58 as heb_cost,
    t1.last_seen_date
FROM list_cost_per_job_run t1 
  LEFT JOIN most_recent_jobs t2 USING (workspace_id, job_id)
GROUP BY ALL
ORDER BY list_cost DESC

datasets.name: 92d0e21e
queryLines:
SELECT
  DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', usage_start_time) AS month,
  SUM(usage_quantity) AS total_dbu_usage
FROM
  system.billing.usage
WHERE
  usage_metadata.cluster_id IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
  DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', usage_start_time)
ORDER BY
  month;

frame.title: Total Actual Consumption
frame.description: Measured by aggregating spend across all workspaces within the HEB Data Platform (GDP)

lines: ### Forecasting Analysis **Green | 1.5% MoM Growth Rate** - This estimate of 1.5% smoothed month-over-month growth of the HEB Data Platform (GDP) was what was used to form the initial estimate of \~41 million consumption over a 5-year period after removing a 42% platform discount. **Red | Actual Trend Line** - This trend line was calculated using actual spend, i.e. the blue bars above, to fit a real trend line based on historical data. Understanding that there were initial initiatives that increased consumption, **overall consumption has been decreasing considerably over time as a percentage: ** - Early period (9/23-2/24): **4.03% average MoM growth** - Middle period (6/24 - 11/24): **3.00% average MoM growth** - Late period (5/25 - 9/25): **2.31% average MoM growth** **Yellow | Meta Prophet Model - Definition & Use Case** - The forecasting model uses Facebook's Prophet algorithm trained on historical data up to the present month to predict the consumption for the next 12 months. To prepare the data for modeling, a 3-month centered moving average was applied to smooth out noise while preserving underlying trends, and extreme outliers were removed by capping values at the 1st and 99th percentiles. The model was configured to detect yearly seasonal patterns using multiplicative seasonality, which allows seasonal effects to scale proportionally with the data level (weekly and daily seasonality was not included).

frame.title: Future Projected Consumption Next 12 Months
frame.description: Taken by averaging the actual trend line (red) with the Meta Prophet forecast (orange)

frame.title: Total HEB Consumption
frame.description: Measured by Aggregating Spend Across All Workspaces

lines:
### Methodology - Meta Prophet Model Trained Pre-Aug. 2024

 

The forecasting model uses Facebook's Prophet algorithm trained on historical data through **August 2024 to measure the value of an optimization effort done during that time period (treated as an "intervention" in this instance).** To prepare the data for modeling, a 3-month centered moving average was applied to smooth out noise while preserving underlying trends, and extreme outliers were removed by capping values at the 1st and 99th percentiles. The model was configured to detect yearly seasonal patterns using multiplicative seasonality, which allows seasonal effects to scale proportionally with the data level (weekly and daily seasonality was not included). *(red line) - (blue bar graph) = projected monthly savings*

### Conclusion

 

We find that the costs to HEB were increasing significantly over the time period pre-Aug. 2024, much above the initial expected growth rate of 1.5% set out in the initial 5-year plan. After the optimization efforts were undertaken, the consumption costs undertaken by HEB were actually stalled/decreased below the 1.5% growth rate in the 12 month period immediately following the intervention. By calculating the difference between the red forecast line ("the track that HEB was going on") and the true cost shown as a blue bar graph ("what actually occurred"), we estimate a savings of 5 million dollars to HEB over this time period.
